content:
Here are some modern and fun Latino inspired recipes that dad will love on Father's Day:

1. Grilled steak with chimichurri sauce - A classic Argentinian dish that features tender grilled flank or skirt steak served with a tangy and herbaceous chimichurri sauce made with parsley, cilantro, garlic, and vinegar.
2. Chorizo and egg breakfast burritos - A hearty and satisfying breakfast option that wraps spicy chorizo sausage, scrambled eggs, and melted cheese in a warm flour tortilla.
3. Cuban-style pulled pork sliders - A crowd-pleasing appetizer or main dish that combines tender and juicy pulled pork seasoned with cumin, oregano, and garlic, served on mini brioche buns with pickles and mustard.
4. Mexican street corn salad - A fresh and flavorful salad that features grilled corn kernels tossed with cotija cheese, lime juice, chili powder, and cilantro, served with crispy tortilla chips on top.
5. Tequila lime chicken wings - A zesty and boozy twist on classic chicken wings that are marinated in tequila, lime juice, and garlic, then grilled to perfection and served with a cilantro lime dipping sauce.
6. Mango habanero salsa - A sweet and spicy salsa that combines juicy ripe mango with fiery habanero peppers, red onion, and lime juice, perfect for dipping chips or serving alongside grilled meats.
7. Tres leches cake with dulce de leche frosting - A decadent and moist cake made with three types of milk and topped with a creamy and rich dulce de leche frosting, garnished with fresh berries or sliced mango.

These recipes offer a modern and fun twist on traditional Latino dishes that are sure to impress and satisfy dad on Father's Day.
